entry.title: James Hervey Price (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that James Hervey Price (pictured) renamed the town of Saugeen to Southampton?

entry.title: Villard Houses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an entrance to one of the Villard Houses was turned into an exit because it was too close to a chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral?

entry.title: Stardust (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Hoagy Carmichael's song "Stardust" has been recorded more than 1,500 times?

entry.title: Wireless Set Number 10 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although the Germans boasted that they captured British radio traffic with ease, the Wireless Set Number 10 was so secure that they never even knew of its existence?

entry.title: KVEA (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after starting Los Angeles Spanish-language television station KVEA, a group led by Saul Steinberg bought other Spanish-language stations to form the Telemundo network?

entry.title: Murray Koster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Murray Koster started for the Sharks rugby team against the British and Irish Lions, paired with Werner Kok?

entry.title: Gelobet sei der Herr täglich (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the church cantata Gelobet sei der Herr täglich (Praised be the Lord daily) by Philipp Heinrich Erlebach for four voices and strings is extant in a manuscript score from around 1710?

entry.title: Kevin Kopps (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kevin Kopps reworked his pitching delivery based on how he played fetch with his dog?
